text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service
This transmits revised text of the IRM 1.18.2, Distribution, Forecasting Requirements.
IRM 1.18.2.8.1, Ordering Training Material, previously IRM 1.18.2.7, (2) updated website
This supersedes IRM 1.18.2 dated November 20, 2020.
Table of Contents

1.18.2.1 Program Scope and Objectives 1.18.2.1.1 Background 1.18.2.1.2 Roles and Responsibilities 1.18.2.1.3 Related Resources 1.18.2.1.4 Acronyms 1.18.2.2 Tax Products Distribution 1.18.2.3 Specialty Requirements Programs 1.18.2.4 Annual Order (AO) and Campus Annual Order (CAO) 1.18.2.5 Monitor Reorder Point (MRP) Program 1.18.2.5.1 Stock Resupply Process 1.18.2.5.1.1 The Survey Process 1.18.2.5.1.2 Stock Transfers 1.18.2.5.1.3 Reprint Requests 1.18.2.5.1.4 Electronic Form 2040 1.18.2.5.1.5 Warehousing and Inventory Control 1.18.2.5.2 Product Reference Material for Ordering 1.18.2.5.3 Informational Tools 1.18.2.6 Envelope Program 1.18.2.7 Internal Management Documents Distribution System (IMDDS) 1.18.2.8 Training Publications Distribution System (TPDS) 1.18.2.8.1 Ordering Training Material

) Purpose: The IRM describes the role of the Forecasting Requirements section in the Distribution Requirements branch (DRB) in determining and requirements and methods of distribution for all public and internal IRS published products. (
) Audience: The procedure applies to all IRS employees, especially those in Media and Publications, Distribution and the Forecasting Requirements section. (
) Policy Owner: Director, Distribution, Media and Publications, Customer tance, Relationships and Education, Wage & Investment division. (
) Program Owner: Distribution Requirements branch is the program office sponsible for determining requirements and methods of distributing IRS published products externally and internally. (

) Policy Stakeholders: Correspondence Production Sites (CPS), National bution Center (NDC), Stakeholder Partnerships, Education & (SPEC), Field Assistance (FA), Publishing, Tax Forms & Publications Learning & Education (L&E), Tax Forms Distribution Program Section (TFDPS), Postal & Transport Policy (P&TP), and all IRS offices. (

) Forecasting involves determining quantity requirements and methods of bution for all public and internal IRS published products. The overall design and management of the IRS forecasting requirements programs systems resides with the Director, Distribution (D)/ Distribution Branch (DRB)/ and Forecasting Requirements (FR) Section. The primary casting distribution programs are: • Tax Products • Specialty Program • Annual Order (AO) • Campus Annual Order (CAO) • Monitor Reorder Point (MRP) • Internal Management Documents Distribution System (IMDDS) • Training Publications Distribution System (TPDS) • Envelope Program (
) The Director of the Distribution division approves and authorizes the policy this IRM
Owner: Director, Distribution, Media and Publications, Customer Assis- Relationships and Education, Wage & Investment division.

) The chief of the Distribution Requirements branch oversees the policy in this IRM. (
) The chief of the Forecasting Requirements section in the Distribution ments branch oversees the daily work of the Forecasting Requirements employees executing the tasks described in this IRM. (
) The employees in the Forecasting Requirements section perform all described in this IRM. (

The following acronyms are used throughout this IRM section.

Acronym Deﬁnition AO Annual Order CAO Campus Annual Order CPS Correspondence Production Services ELITE Enterprise Logistics Information Technology ESN Electronic Status Notice IMDDS Internal Management Documents Distribution System IRM Internal Revenue Manual MRP Monitor Reorder Point NDC National Distribution Center OPN Order Point Number OSMS Order Subscription Management System PSDS Publishing Services Distribution System PSR Publishing Services Request TF&P Tax Forms and Publications TPDS Training Publications Distribution Systems VITA Volunteer Income Tax Assistance
Requirements

) The FR section closely monitors, plans, coordinates, controls and executes distribution of tax products to IRS offices, outlet partners and the public. Products forms, instructions and publications are the primary method for the public to meet their ﬁling requirements. Each tax product is the result of new or legislation, regulations or rulings, court decisions and public feedback. (

) The FR section determines distribution requirements for most tax products originate in the Tax Forms and Publications (TF&P) division of M&P. This program does not include tax products developed for direct mailouts. FR analysts gather and monitor tax products requirements from several including the Correspondence Production Services (CPS) sites, the Distribution Center (NDC), and programs maintained in the Tax Forms tion Program Section (TFDPS). (

) Some seasonal distribution programs coincide with the tax products peak season distribution. These programs include, but are not limited to: Requirements • Volunteer Income Tax Assistance (VITA) Distribution • Marketing-Promotional Products Distribution (

) These products may ship directly from a print contractor to the end user or the NDC for redistribution. M&P’s Publishing division and IRS product tors must establish shipping requirements during the product planning (

) AO and CAO program analysts determine print requirements and distribute large volume of printed products with consistent usage to Campus, CPS Order (AO) and and NDC warehouses. AO and CAO products support program workloads Annual Order Submission Processing, Accounts Management, Compliance, and Programs dence processing operations. (
) CAO products are for internal use and are stocked only at the campuses CPS warehouses. (
) AO products are for internal and public use and are stocked at the and CPS and NDC warehouses. (
) Campus customers order stock from their local warehouse for AO and CAO products. (
) Field offices and the public order from the NDC. (

) The MRP program consists of products with low or inconsistent usage. Customers are IRS offices, including the campuses, order MRP products Reorder Point the NDC to request stock on an as-needed basis. Program (

) Stock Resupply involves several phases. FR staff survey, transfer and/or reprint products based on formalized production schedules or when a Resupply Process balance on hand is below the reorder point. No.

AO and CAO program analysts determine print requirements and distribute large volume of printed products with consistent usage to Campus, CPS sites and NDC warehouses. AO and CAO products support program workloads for Submission Processing, Accounts Management, Compliance, and Correspon-
(10-14-2022) Annual Order (AO) and Campus Annual Order (CAO) Programs
Stock Resupply involves several phases. FR staff survey, transfer and/or reprint products based on formalized production schedules or when a product’s balance on hand is below the reorder point.
) FR analysts generally survey products in AO and CAO programs once a The annual survey is pre-populated with the product’s

-month usage, Process balance on hand, and the FR analysts’ projected print forecast. Campuses CPS warehouse forms coordinators conﬁrm the projected print forecast after they complete the following: • Contact each customer area (e.g., Compliance, Submission etc.) using the product to determine program changes that may usage • Review inventory reports to determine accurate annual usage • Determine the accuracy of their balance on hand information (warehouse or in work area) • Indicate, when necessary, the adjusted projected print forecast • Return the survey by due-in-date The FR analyst determines the NDC usage by reviewing the survey data to determine if a stock transfer or reprint is needed. (
) If shortages of stock occur between survey periods, then campuses, the sites, and the NDC can request a transfer by submitting Form
– Warehouse Resupply and Stock Transfer Request. FR analysts resolve transfer requests within
hours. When a transfer is not possible, then the analyst requests a reprint. We cover reprint requests in IRM
below. Note: Campuses, the CPS, and the NDC will complete transfers within
hours receiving the request. The FR analyst closes out the TFORDERs within
hours after completing the transfer request. (

) FR Analysts request reprints through the Product Business Originators on an as-needed basis to replenish stock levels for Campus, CPS sites and the warehouse. Originating offices have two available options to request a. Submit request online using the Publishing Services Request (PSR) system at http://caps-as.enterprise.irs.gov/psr/app b. Submit a completed Form
, Publishing Services Requisition, with authorized business and funding approvals, to the Publishing function M&P Note: See http://publish.no.irs.gov/appls/pst
c
html for a list of authorized approvers. (
) The originator’s duties include monitoring their print requisition status and ensuring the technical content has not changed.

) If shortages of stock occur between survey periods, then campuses, the CPS sites, and the NDC can request a transfer by submitting Form
– Warehouse Resupply and Stock Transfer Request. FR analysts resolve transfer requests within
hours. When a transfer is not possible, then the FR analyst requests a reprint. We cover reprint requests in IRM
below.

FR Analysts request reprints through the Product Business Originators on an as-needed basis to replenish stock levels for Campus, CPS sites and the NDC warehouse. Originating offices have two available options to request reprints:
a. Submit request online using the Publishing Services Request (PSR) system at http://caps-as.enterprise.irs.gov/psr/app b. Submit a completed Form
, Publishing Services Requisition, with authorized business and funding approvals, to the Publishing function M&P
Note: See http://publish.no.irs.gov/appls/pst01c2.html for a list of authorized approvers.
The originator’s duties include monitoring their print requisition status and ensuring the technical content has not changed.
ensuring the technical content has not changed. FR Analysts must input all requirements for printed materials warehoused at the campuses, the CPS, and the NDC using the electronic Form

, Distribution/Shipping List application. The application interfaces with the Pub- lishing Services Data system (PSD) which helps track the status and progress of shipments. The FR Analyst must list all locations receiving stock on the
this includes IRS offices, outlet partner, contractor and other governmen- tal agencies. The
application uses both speciﬁc and generic order points number for address information.
Exception: Do not enter IRM distribution envelopes on Form 2040.

is required for departmental random copies, also known as blue labels, for all IRS printed products shipping to campus warehouses or the NDC. Refer to Publishing Procedure
or Distribution Procedure

) Campuses, the CPS, and the NDC should establish receiving and inventory control methods that ensure: a. Quality products are distributed b. Sufficient stock is available to meet customer needs c. Government printing costs are kept low (

) Campuses, the CPS, and the NDC should establish procedures that accurate records for: • Product receipts • Quality review of products • Stock issues • Keeping records consistent with the Electronic Status Notice (ESN) system • Stock disposals • Transaction history that provides an audit trail • Transfer requests • Requirements planning • Matching local OPNs with IMDDS records (

) Product information is available on the Publishing and Distribution Publishing website Catalog tab at http://publish.no.irs.gov/catlg.html. The uct information provided at the site includes: • Catalog Number • Publishing Analyst • Distribution Analyst • Revision Information • Originating Office/Product Originator (
) Offices can order NDC-stocked materials using the Order and Subscription Management System (OSMS) at hom
age.xhtml. The OSMS also contains an online catalog to search for NDC-stocked products. (
) The Form
application and the PSDS databases provide Publishing Distribution employees with the latest information on shipping, delivery, and status of reprints of printed materials. (
) Shipping, delivery, and availability of printed material information Is also on the Publishing Distribution website Services tab at servc.html. Internal Revenue Manual

) The Envelope Programs consists of large volume preprinted address and parent standard envelopes to support taxpayer correspondence or Program use. These are only available for campus internal ordering (

) FR analysts manage envelopes for seven campus inventories at the NDC. FR Analysts determine print quantity requirements three times a year and completes the Envelope Order Summary (EOS) spreadsheet. The completed spreadsheet is then sent to Publishing. (
) The FR Analysts provide Publishing and Campus customer support ordering, inventory questions, new version envelope creation, etc. (
) The IMDDS program automatically distributes IRMs to IRS offices per Document
) Receiving IRS offices must maintain and update their IMDDS subscriptions Distribution OSMS at https://caps-as.enterprise.irs.gov/osms/views/hom
age.xhtml. (

) The TPDS is designed to support IRS training needs. TPDS consists of materials (multiple products) and individual products. Items are printed com- mercially and/or by print-on-demand at the NDC. The NDC provides order System fulﬁllment and print-on-demand services to Learning and Education (L&E) for TPDS material. (

) The two types of TPDS orders are course and product orders: • Course orders are requests for complete sets of speciﬁc course Training materials • Product orders are requests for individual products (
) Document

-A, Training Course Catalog, is a complete listing of TPDS courses customers can order from the NDC. Distribution updates Doc. daily, and it is available electronically on M&P’s website at gov/pubsys/training/training.html#tab=tab

When placing a course order, to the document to obtain the course catalog number. Using the course number will ensure that all materials associated with a particular course are sent to the requestor. (

) To order TPDS products, the requestor must use a TPDS order point A listing of TPDS order point numbers is posted on the Publishing and Distri- bution website at http://publish.no.irs.gov/distsys/imdds/trainopn.html. ers must place all TPDS orders using the OSMS at http://caps-as.enterprise. irs.gov/osms/views/hom
age.xhtml.
The FR Analysts provide Publishing and Campus customer support regarding ordering, inventory questions, new version envelope creation, etc.
Receiving IRS offices must maintain and update their IMDDS subscriptions OSMS at https://caps-as.enterprise.irs.gov/osms/views/homePage.xhtml.

fulﬁllment and print-on-demand services to Learning and Education (L&E) for TPDS material. (
) The two types of TPDS orders are course and product orders: • Course orders are requests for complete sets of speciﬁc course materials • Product orders are requests for individual products (
) Document
-A, Training Course Catalog, is a complete listing of TPDS courses customers can order from the NDC. Distribution updates Doc.
-A daily, and it is available electronically on M&P’s website at http://publish.no.irs. gov/pubsys/training/training.html#tab=tab

When placing a course order, refer to the document to obtain the course catalog number. Using the course catalog number will ensure that all materials associated with a particular course are sent to the requestor. (

) To order TPDS products, the requestor must use a TPDS order point number. A listing of TPDS order point numbers is posted on the Publishing and Distri- bution website at http://publish.no.irs.gov/distsys/imdds/trainopn.html. Custom- ers must place all TPDS orders using the OSMS at http://caps-as.enterprise. irs.gov/osms/views/hom
